title: STEM-Based Problem-Centered Mathematics Problem-Solving Enhancement Program for Engineering Students

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering mathematics (calculus, linear algebra) and understanding of problem-solving frameworks
context.additional_context: For pre-service/in-service teachers, emphasizing practical engineering problem-solving skills. Environment established for using digital tools (GeoGebra, MATLAB)

learning_goals: Utilize the STEM-PBL approach in real engineering problem contexts to derive creative solutions with over 80% accuracy.
Perform mathematical modeling and simulations using GeoGebra/MATLAB, and visualize the problem-solving process.
Construct and execute a systematic process for analyzing, solving, and evaluating complex engineering problems in three or more stages.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
